title: Alex Jones Show - 2013 Aug 02 FR [sebaygo1]
description:
The Alex Jones Show
Friday, 02 August 2013


[sebaygo1]


Show Description
................

From the Infowars web site :: On this Friday, August 2 edition of The Alex Jones Show, Alex covers the fact the Benghazi attack was an arms deal gone bad, a story we broke weeks ago when the corporate media was throwing out cover stories to see what would stick. 

He also takes a look at DARPA's effort to engineer a 47th chromosome. 

On today's show, Alex welcomes back British journalist and author James Delingpole who recently revealed that 97 percent of climate activists are taking money from big oil. Delingpole will also talk about Halliburton agreeing to plead guilty to destruction of critical evidence after the Gulf of Mexico oil spill in 2010. 

Alex also talks with film editor and director Michael Dorhmann, winner of the Paul Revere Contest.

 It is my opinion that in this time it is virtually essential 
 to seek information from a variety of sources, to listen to a
 spectrum of voices in order to better  understand the "big 
 picture." A reliance solely upon mainstream corporate media 
 for news and info is a prescription for ignorance. I try to
 share information that counters the monotone of mainstream
 corporate media. 

 NOTE: The material here is made available strictly as
 information. Do not assume my support for or endorsement 
 of the contents.

 Think for yourself! To paraphrase the late William Cooper: 
 Read everything, listen to everything, but believe nothing 
 until you've researched it yourself.
